page.title: 17Tourist Attractions 1.
page.content: { The Royal Oak This is a well known public_house in Great Ayton,and used to be a Coaching Inn. A sundial is placed on the front wall of the Royal Oak,containing the{ {Latin}words {Deus adest laborantibus (God helps those who work) and the date 1771 when the pub was built. {The Waterfall You will find the waterfall opposite Suggitts.In 1840,The Waterfall Terrace houses were flooded when the high mill dam gave way.It was built with a donation from{Thomas Richardson in 1840.You will find his initials engraved on the stone wall on the far side of the river. {The Victorian Urinal The Victorian Urinal can be found in Station Road.Painted a maroon red with attractive patterns,it is still in use today.
